result.execSummary:
The defendant Lavontae M Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
With Huber, release for work, work search, education and treatment.
Credit for 52 days, IF REVOKED.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

miscConds.notes:
Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Mental Health Evaluation and any treatment recommended by Agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Not to use or possess of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription.
Work on obtaining a Valid Driver's license within the first 19 months of probation.
No new law violations.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
Follow through with current mental health treatment and medications.
All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.
No contact with Sahara Trading Post, Designer Shoe Warehouse, or Victim A or Victim B.
